SEARCH
Package io.github.thacbao.itemcf.api

Class RecommendationEngine

java.lang.Object
io.github.thacbao.itemcf.api.RecommendationEngine
public class RecommendationEngine extends Object
Main entry point of the ItemCF library.

This class orchestrates the full Item-based Collaborative Filtering pipeline:

  1. Load — reads user-item interactions from InteractionLoader
  2. Build matrix — constructs the item-user sparse matrix
  3. Compute — calculates pairwise similarities using the configured SimilarityStrategy
  4. Store — persists results via SimilarityStore
  5. Query — retrieves similar items or personalized recommendations

Usage


 RecommendationConfig config = RecommendationConfig.builder()
         .similarityThreshold(0.15)
         .minCommonUsers(2)
         .topKSimilar(50)
         .batchSize(1000)
         .build();

 RecommendationEngine engine = new RecommendationEngine(
         myInteractionLoader, // your JPA/JDBC adapter
         mySimilarityStore, // your JPA/Redis adapter
         config);

 // Run periodically (e.g., from @Scheduled in Spring or a Quartz job)
 engine.calculateAndStoreSimilarities();

 // Query at runtime
 List<RecommendationResult> similar = engine.getSimilarItems(productId, 10);
 List<RecommendationResult> forUser = engine.getRecommendationsForUser(userId, 20,
         myInteractionLoader, Set.of()); // pass user's interaction history

This class is thread-safe for query operations (getSimilarItems(int, int), getRecommendationsForUser(int, java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer>, int)). Concurrent calls to calculateAndStoreSimilarities() are allowed but not recommended.

  • Constructor Details

    • RecommendationEngine

      public RecommendationEngine(InteractionLoader loader, SimilarityStore store, RecommendationConfig config)
      Creates a new engine with the given ports and configuration.
      Parameters:
      loader - the source of user-item interactions
      store - where computed similarity scores are persisted and queried
      config - algorithm configuration

  • Method Details

    • calculateAndStoreSimilarities

      public void calculateAndStoreSimilarities()
      Runs a full recalculation of all item-similarity scores.

      Steps:

      1. Clears existing similarity data from the store.
      2. Loads all interactions via InteractionLoader in batches.
      3. Computes pairwise similarities.
      4. Saves results to the store in configurable batch sizes.
      5. Evicts cached recommendations.

      This method is designed to be called from a scheduler (e.g., Spring @Scheduled, Quartz, or a plain ScheduledExecutorService).

    • getSimilarItems

      public List<RecommendationResult> getSimilarItems(int itemId, int limit)
      Returns the top-limit items most similar to the given item.

      Results are served from cache if available (when a CachePort implementation is configured). Otherwise, they are fetched from the store.

      Parameters:
      itemId - the reference item ID
      limit - maximum number of results to return
      Returns:
      similar items ordered by similarity score descending

    • getRecommendationsForUser

      public List<RecommendationResult> getRecommendationsForUser(int userId, Set<Integer> userInteractedItems, int limit)
      Returns personalized item recommendations for a user based on their interaction history.

      Algorithm:

      1. For each item the user has interacted with, look up its similar items.
      2. Aggregate similarity scores (sum) across all source items.
      3. Filter out items the user has already interacted with.
      4. Return the top-limit items by aggregated score.

      If the user has no interactions, or no similar items can be found, returns an empty list. The caller should fall back to popular items.

      Parameters:
      userId - the user to recommend items for
      userInteractedItems - set of item IDs the user has already interacted with
      limit - maximum number of results to return
      Returns:
      personalized recommendations ordered by aggregated score descending
